properties.abstract:
The highest point between Centovalli and Lago Maggiore is called “Gridone o M. Limidario” on the Swiss map. However, if you ascend through Val di Bordei to the summit, you will find Ghiridone painted on prominent boulders. So, what is the correct name?
Both. Very often in the Ticino canton more than one name is in use, one in the local dialect and another in the standard Italian language. While Ghiridone is the standard name used by many in the region around Locarno and Centovalli, the people from Brissago prefer calling the mountain Gridone in their dialect, formerly also Cridone or Gredone. Monte Limidario is used on the Italian side of the border and is derived from the Latin word “limes” (border). But it may not have denoted today’s border between Switzerland and Italy, but the boundary line between pastures and rock.
properties.subtitle: An overwhelming vantage point with a number of names
properties.title: Rasa - Gridone - Rifugio al Legn

sac_photos.title: Viewed from Valle Vigezzo, Gridone (left) and Rocce del Gridone look impressive.

segments.description: Descend south through the quiet and well-preserved mountain village and past the monumental church of Terra Vecchia. Cross the creek at P. 663 and ascend gently to Bordei (726 m).

photos.caption: Viewed rrom Valle Vigezzo, Gridone (left) and Rocce del Gridone look impressive.

segments.title: Rasa – Bordei

segments.description: From Bordei ascend about 5 minutes on the small road until in the bend at 780 m the hiking trail branches off right into Val di Bordei, crossing shortly afterwards the rushing creek on a wooden bridge at P. 789. The trail leads around some boulders ascending gently through the fairly wide and shady valley floor until at ca. 880 m it crosses the creek again to reach the other side of the valley. Now the valley narrows, and the trail ascends more steeply southward, traverses a tributary creek at around 1060 m and zigzags up through brushwood to the small hunter shed (ca. 1380 m). It is mostly open and offers welcome shelter in case of a sudden weather change. However, as it is humid and grubby inside, it is not inviting enough for a longer stay. Afterwards the trail crosses the main creek yet again. From P. 1433 on the trail continues on a ridge interspersed with bushes via P. 1594. At an altitude of about 1800 m Val di Bordei widens to become a high plateau, from whose eastern edge one reaches Bocchetta di Valle (1948 m) in a wide arc. The spectacular view down to Lago Maggiore and further on to the Apennine range encourages taking a long break in the wide saddle. From Bocchetta di Valle many trails lead up to the mighty summit cross of Gridone. They all reach P. 1999. An interesting route is across some small rocky ledges and north-westward to reach the wide ridge at an altitude of ca. 2130 m. The last metres to the Gridone summit (2188 m) are unproblematic on schrofen, slightly on the Italian side of the ridge.
segments.title: Bordei - Gridone

segments.description: The descent from the summit to Capanna Al Legn follows the ridge until ca. 2130 m on the route of the ascent, then it continues on the ridge until shortly after the rocky outcrop at P. 2138, where you can descend to Bocchetta di Valle on a distinct rib. Following the markings hike eastward on a faint path to reach Rifugio Al Legn (1785 m) in a few minutes. It is located on a splendid terrace high above Lago Maggiore.

photos.caption: Perfect view down to the Maggia delta

segments.title: Gridone - Rifugio Al Legn
